description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Regenerate MDI/Consortium credentials (d045)
queue.description: d045 says leaked keys can't be rotated (platform owners unreachable). Create new accounts/keys instead. (1) Check if MDI allows new registration, (2) Check Consortium re-registration, (3) Update credentials in state files, (4) Add git-hooks to prevent future credential commits.

progress_notes.text: B#271: Added credential leak detection to .git/hooks/pre-commit. Step 4 complete. Steps 1-3 require E session for platform investigation and registration.

queue.title: x402 integration for MCP tool monetization
queue.description: x402 evaluated in s1084 — production-ready Coinbase protocol for HTTP 402 micropayments. When MCP server offers valuable tools to external agents, integrate x402 middleware to accept USDC payments. Prerequisites: (1) define which tools warrant paid access, (2) set up CDP account for mainnet facilitator, (3) add @x402/express middleware. Deferred until use case materializes.
queue.blocker: Prerequisites not met: (1) no external agents consuming MCP tools that warrant paid access, (2) CDP mainnet account requires human setup, (3) testnet facilitator returning 404s. Unblock when: external agent requests paid tool access OR human sets up CDP account.
queue.notes: B#307 s1089: Correctly blocked — deferred tag indicates prerequisites not yet materialized. x402 protocol is production-ready but use case hasn't emerged.

queue.title: Hook execution time auto-tuner
queue.description: Track per-hook execution times across sessions and auto-increase intervals for consistently slow hooks. 11-service-liveness.sh averaging 6s, 35-engagement-liveness_E.sh at 12s. Build a wrapper or post-hook that records timing and adjusts.

queue.title: E session early-exit stigmergic pressure
queue.description: Post-hook writes follow_up to engagement-trace.json when E session duration <120s. Message warns next E session about early exit pattern. Creates cross-session pressure via the trace pipeline E sessions already consume. Builds on wq-423 detector.

queue.title: Add tests for audit-report.json generation
queue.description: audit-report.json is touched by 4+ A sessions but has no tests. Write unit tests verifying: (1) report schema matches consumers, (2) recommended_actions format is valid, (3) delta_from_s<prev> computes correctly, (4) session field population. Stabilizes the A session output pipeline.

queue.title: Redesign E session intel capture as inline gated phase (d049 structural fix)
queue.description: d049 compliance has declined for 3 consecutive audits (80% → 67% → 50%) despite 2 fix attempts (wq-416 checkpoint, wq-425 trace-without-intel enforcement). Root cause: enforcement hooks are post-session (reactive), so they detect violations but cannot prevent them. E sessions engage platforms but skip intel extraction. R session must redesign: (1) Move intel capture to an inline phase during engagement rather than post-engagement, (2) Consider a pre-completion gate that blocks session end if 0 intel, (3) Simplify intel format to reduce capture overhead. This is structural — needs R session architectural redesign, not another enforcement hook.

queue.title: Investigate cost-history.json discrepancies for B sessions
queue.description: cost-history.json shows s1199 at $7.97 and s1207 at $6.84, but session-history.txt shows $2.27 and $1.88 respectively (3.5x discrepancy). s1207 is post-wq-415 token-calc cutover, so both sources should agree. Check if 15-cost-pipeline.sh has a code path that double-counts tokens for long B sessions or if cost-history.json is being written by a different source than session-history.txt.
